sen.j: 岩倉 具集（いわくら ともあい、安永 (元号)7年9月7日 (旧暦)（1778年10月26日） - 嘉永6年5月16日 (旧暦)（1853年6月22日））は岩倉具選の子。
sen.e: Tomoai IWAKURA (October 26, 1778 - June 22, 1853) was a son of Tomokazu IWAKURA.
Tomoai IWAKURA (October 26, 1778 - June 22, 1853) was a son of Tomokazu IWAKURA.
Tomoai IWAKURA (October 26, 1778 - June 22, 1853) was a son of Tomokazu IWAKURA.
Tomoai's mother was a daughter of Ariyoshi AYANOKOJI.
His mother was a daughter of Ariyoshi AYANOKOJI.
His mother was a daughter of Ariyoshi AYANOKOJI.

sen.j: 正室は綾小路俊資の娘。
sen.e: Tomoai's lawful wife ('seishitsu' in Japanese) was a daughter of Toshisuke AYANOKOJI.
His lawful wife ('seishitsu' in Japanese) was a daughter of Toshisuke AYANOKOJI.
His lawful wife ('seishitsu' in Japanese) was a daughter of Toshisuke AYANOKOJI.

sen.j: 実子に岩倉具満、養子に岩倉具賢（今城定成の子）、岩倉具慶（大原重成二男）がいる。
sen.e: Tomoai had a biological son named Tomomitsu IWAKURA and adopted sons named Tomokata IWAKURA (who was a biological son of Sadashige IMAKI) and Tomoyasu IWAKURA (the second son of Shigenari OHARA).
He had a biological son named Tomomitsu IWAKURA and adopted sons named Tomokata IWAKURA (who was a biological son of Sadashige IMAKI) and Tomoyasu IWAKURA (the second son of Shigenari OHARA).
He had a biological son named Tomomitsu IWAKURA and adopted sons named Tomokata IWAKURA (who was a biological son of Sadashige IMAKI) and Tomoyasu IWAKURA (the second son of Shigenari OHARA).
Tomoai's official court rank was Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
His official court rank was Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
His official court rank was Shonii (Senior Second Rank).

sen.j: 大国隆正に入門し、画を能くする。
sen.e: Tomoai was a disciple of Takamasa OKUNI and was a skillful painter.
He was a disciple of Takamasa OKUNI and was a skillful painter.
He was a disciple of Takamasa OKUNI and was a skillful painter.

sen.j: 安永7年（1778年）に岩倉具選の子として生まれる。
sen.e: In 1778 Tomoai was born to Tomokazu IWAKURA.
In 1778 he was born to Tomokazu IWAKURA.
In 1778 he was born to Tomokazu IWAKURA.

sen.j: 文化7年12月21日 (旧暦)（1811年1月15日）に叙従三位。
sen.e: On January 15, 1811, Tomoai was conferred an official court rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: 原文に対応西暦日付を補足のうえ訳出しました。http://keisan.casio.jp/has10/SpecExec.cgi
sen.e: On January 15, 1811, he was conferred an official court rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: Tomoaiは代名詞にしました。西暦確認しました。
sen.e: On January 15, 1811, he was conferred an official court rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).

sen.j: 天保10年（1839年）に正二位、権大納言となる。
sen.e: In 1839 Tomoai was raised to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Dainagon (Major Counselor).
In 1839 he was raised to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Gon Dainagon (Provisional Chief Councilor of State).
sen.cmt: 権が訳抜けのため、登録の用語に（説明も含め）修正しました。Tomoaiは代名詞にしました
sen.e: In 1839 he was raised to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Gon Dainagon (Provisional Chief Councilor of State).
In 1853 Tomoai died.
In 1853 he died.
In 1853 he died.
Tomoai died at the age of 76.
He died at the age of 76.
He died at the age of 76.
